#Text=Wikinews Shorts : April 3 , 2007
#Text=A compilation of brief news reports for
#Text=Tuesday , April 3 , 2007
#Text=.
#Text=US : Former FBI agent missing in Iran
#Text=On Monday , the United States said it sent an official inquiry to Iran via Swiss diplomats about a former FBI agent who went missing while in Iran on private business .
#Text=He is believed to have gone missing several weeks ago on the island of Kish .
#Text=The FBI say he has not worked for them in a decade nor is he a contractor for them .
#Text=A US State Department spokesperson declined to give name , age or occupation of the missing man .
#Text=The spokesperson also said that they have no indication that he is being held by any Iranian entity .
#Text=Sources
#Text=Sue Pleming . " U.S. says former FBI agent missing in Iran " — Reuters , April 2 , 2007
#Text=Matthew Lee , AP .
#Text=" Former FBI agent missing in Iran " — USA Today , April 2 , 2007

column1: #Text=Asian markets set positive outlook for stocks
#Text=In early action , Asian and Oceanian markets rose while the markets pondered the impact of the United States - South Korea free trade agreement .
#Text=In Japanese markets , Monday 's fears that the Institute for Supply Management ' s report would say manufacturing growth slowed more than forecast in March actually came true .

#Text=However , " US markets turned out more stable than people feared yesterday and that prompted buying back of large-cap stocks , " said Yoshihisa Okamoto of Fuji Investment Management Co. in Tokyo .
#Text=Sources
#Text=" Asian markets push ahead " — Reuters , April 2,2007
#Text=Makiko Suzuki .
#Text=" Japanese Stocks Advance ; Matsushita , Mitsubishi UFJ Lead Gains " — Bloomberg L.P. , April 3 , 2007
#Text=British hacker to be extradited to US
#Text=Gary McKinnon
#Text=of Britain lost his appeal challenging an extradition order to face charges in the United States that he hacked into military and NASA computers there .
#Text=" We do not find any grounds of appeal against the decision , " said one of the judges , Lord Justice Maurice Kay .

#Text=In what has been called the " biggest military hack of all time , " McKinnon allegedly used the code-name Solo as he hacked into 97 computers and caused $ 700,000 worth of damage according to US prosecutors .
#Text=In 2006 , he told The Guardian that he was searching for evidence the Americans might have about UFOs .
#Text=Related news
#Text=" UK hacker faces extradition to US " — Wikinews , May 10 , 2006
#Text=Sources
#Text=" British hacker loses U.S. extradition appeal " — Reuters , April 3 , 2007
#Text=Mark Tran .
#Text=" Briton loses extradition fight over US military hacking " — Guardian Unlimited , April 3 , 2007

column1: #Text=US Supreme Court rules against EPA on carbon dioxide regulation
#Text=The US Supreme Court ruled 5-4 that carbon dioxide should be regulated by the Environmental Protection Agency ( EPA ) .
#Text=The majority opinion said that the EPA had offered " no reasoned explanation " for refusing to regulate carbon dioxide emissions from cars .
#Text=Previously the EPA had argued that the 1970 Clean Air Act did not give it the powers to regulate green house gases because they were not deemed to be pollutants .

#Text=Twelve states and several environmental groups jointly brought the case against the EPA , contending that it was failing in its legal duty to regulate environmental pollution by not regulating green house gas emissions .
#Text=Sources
#Text=Robert Barnes and Juliet Eilperin .
#Text=" Supreme Court : EPA Can Regulate Car Emissions " — Washington Post Online , April 2 , 2007
